intro: Trisciadium, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open areas. Trisciadium has a fibrous root system and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It is typically annual or biennial in growth habit and is not commonly cultivated for ornamental purposes.
